required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study With Neupro® to Evaluate the Patient´s Perception of Pain Associated With Parkinson´s Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Non-interventional Study With Neupro® to Evaluate the Perception of Pain Associated With Idiopathic Parkinson's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to evaluate the perception of pain associated with Parkinson´s Disease in patients who receive Neupro® for the first time.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Visit 2 in the Sum Score Calculated From the 4 Items of the Affective Dimension of the Pain Description List (Schmerzbeschreibungsliste SBL, Question 10) of the German Pain Questionnaire
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Day 0) to Visit 2 (after at least 4 weeks on a maintenance dose of Neupro®)
primary_outcome.description: The Pain Description List (SBL, question 10) is part of the validated German Pain Questionnaire (DSF). The SBL consists of a 12 item list of adjectives. Each adjective is ranked from 0 (not applicable) to 3 (exactly applicable). 8 of the 12 adjectives will be used to assess the sensory items of pain and 4 adjectives to describe the affective items of pain. The 8 sensory items are used to assess qualitative description of pain. For the 4 affective pain items, a sum score ranges from 0 (not applicable) to 12 (exactly applicable). Values above 8 can be considered noticeable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Visit 2 in the Sum Score of the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Part II
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Day 0) to Visit 2 (after at least 4 weeks on a maintenance dose of Neupro®)
secondary_outcome.description: The UPDRS is a scale for the assessment of function in Parkinson's disease. Part II measures 'Activities of Daily Living'. It consists of 13 questions, each ranging from 0 (none) to 4 (severe abnormalities). The sum score of the UPDRS Part II ranges from 0 (normal) to 52 (worst score possible).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Visit 2 in the Sum Score of the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Part III
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Day 0) to Visit 2 (after at least 4 weeks on a maintenance dose of Neupro®)
secondary_outcome.description: The UPDRS is a scale for the assessment of function in Parkinson's disease. Part III measures 'Motor Function'. It consists of 14 items with 27 questions, each ranging from 0 (normal) to 4 (severe abnormalities). The sum score of the UPDRS Part III ranges from 0 (normal) to 108 (worst score possible).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Visit 2 in the Sum Score of the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Parts II+III
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Day 0) to Visit 2 (after at least 4 weeks on a maintenance dose of Neupro®)
secondary_outcome.description: The UPDRS is a scale for the assessment of function in Parkinson's disease. Part II measures 'Activities of Daily Living' and Part III 'Motor Function'. They consist of 40 questions, each ranging from 0 (normal) to 4 (severe abnormalities). The sum score of the UPDRS Part II+III ranges from 0 (normal) to 160 (worst score possible).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Visit 2 in the Short-form Parkinson's Disease Questionnaire (PDQ-8) Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Day 0) to Visit 2 (after at least 4 weeks on a maintenance dose of Neupro®)
secondary_outcome.description: The PDQ-8 is a self-administered 8 item questionnaire that assesses the overall health status. The questions will be rated from 0 (never) to 4 (always [or cannot do at all]). The total score ranges from 0 (never) to 32 (always [or cannot do at all]) with lower scores indicating a better health status.

arm_group.description: Routine treatment with Neupro® (2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16 mg/24 h) as per approved label in the EU, which is applicable in the EU member state Germany.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with pain associated with idiopathic Parkinson´s Disease. Every consecutive, eligible patient to be treated with Neupro® as per physician's decision.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The decision by the treating physician to treat a patient with Neupro® for the first time is made before the patient's participation in this Non-Interventional Study (NIS)
- A Patient Data Consent form is signed and dated by the patient
- Male and female patients that suffer from pain associated with idiopathic Parkinson's Disease according to the physician's assessment
- Patients have not been treated with Rotigotine in the past

results_reference.citation: Timmermann L, Oehlwein C, Ransmayr G, Fröhlich H, Will E, Schroeder H, Lauterbach T, Bauer L, Kassubek J. Patients' perception of Parkinson's disease-associated pain following initiation of rotigotine: a multicenter non-interventional study. Postgrad Med. 2017 Jan;129(1):46-54. doi: 10.1080/00325481.2017.1258953. Epub 2016 Nov 24.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study started to enroll subjects in May 2012. Overall, 28 sites enrolled 93 patients in this study.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participant Flow refers to the Enrolled Set (ES).

group.title: Neupro® Treatment
group.description: Routine treatment with Neupro® (2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16 mg/24 h) as per approved label in the EU, which is applicable in the EU member states Germany and Austria.

baseline.population: Baseline Characteristics refer to the Safety Set, including all enrolled patients who had applied the rotigotine transdermal patch at least once.

group.title: Neupro® Treatment
group.description: Routine treatment with Neupro® (2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16 mg/24 h) as per approved label in the EU, which is applicable in the EU member states Germany and Austria.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Visit 2 in the Sum Score Calculated From the 4 Items of the Affective Dimension of the Pain Description List (Schmerzbeschreibungsliste SBL, Question 10) of the German Pain Questionnaire
outcome.description: The Pain Description List (SBL, question 10) is part of the validated German Pain Questionnaire (DSF). The SBL consists of a 12 item list of adjectives. Each adjective is ranked from 0 (not applicable) to 3 (exactly applicable). 8 of the 12 adjectives will be used to assess the sensory items of pain and 4 adjectives to describe the affective items of pain. The 8 sensory items are used to assess qualitative description of pain. For the 4 affective pain items, a sum score ranges from 0 (not applicable) to 12 (exactly applicable). Values above 8 can be considered noticeable.
outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Day 0) to Visit 2 (after at least 4 weeks on a maintenance dose of Neupro®)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS). The FAS includes all enrolled patients who had applied the rotigotine transdermal patch at least once and for whom valid data for the primary effectiveness variable were available from Baseline and a subsequent routine visit.

group.title: Neupro® Treatment
group.description: Routine treatment with Neupro® (2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16 mg/24 h) as per approved label in the EU, which is applicable in the EU member states Germany and Austria.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Visit 2 in the Sum Score Calculated From the 4 Items of the Affective Dimension of the Pain Description List (Schmerzbeschreibungsliste SBL, Question 10) of the German Pain Questionnaire
measure.description: The Pain Description List (SBL, question 10) is part of the validated German Pain Questionnaire (DSF). The SBL consists of a 12 item list of adjectives. Each adjective is ranked from 0 (not applicable) to 3 (exactly applicable). 8 of the 12 adjectives will be used to assess the sensory items of pain and 4 adjectives to describe the affective items of pain. The 8 sensory items are used to assess qualitative description of pain. For the 4 affective pain items, a sum score ranges from 0 (not applicable) to 12 (exactly applicable). Values above 8 can be considered noticeable.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS). The FAS includes all enrolled patients who had applied the rotigotine transdermal patch at least once and for whom valid data for the primary effectiveness variable were available from Baseline and a subsequent routine visit.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Visit 2 in the Sum Score of the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Part II
outcome.description: The UPDRS is a scale for the assessment of function in Parkinson's disease. Part II measures 'Activities of Daily Living'. It consists of 13 questions, each ranging from 0 (none) to 4 (severe abnormalities). The sum score of the UPDRS Part II ranges from 0 (normal) to 52 (worst score possible).
outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Day 0) to Visit 2 (after at least 4 weeks on a maintenance dose of Neupro®)
outcome.population: Of the 70 patients in the Full Analysis Set (FAS), 68 patients had complete data for UPDRS Part II and are included in the analysis of this outcome measure.

group.title: Neupro® Treatment
group.description: Routine treatment with Neupro® (2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16 mg/24 h) as per approved label in the EU, which is applicable in the EU member states Germany and Austria.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Visit 2 in the Sum Score of the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Part II
measure.description: The UPDRS is a scale for the assessment of function in Parkinson's disease. Part II measures 'Activities of Daily Living'. It consists of 13 questions, each ranging from 0 (none) to 4 (severe abnormalities). The sum score of the UPDRS Part II ranges from 0 (normal) to 52 (worst score possible).
measure.population: Of the 70 patients in the Full Analysis Set (FAS), 68 patients had complete data for UPDRS Part II and are included in the analysis of this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Visit 2 in the Sum Score of the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Part III
outcome.description: The UPDRS is a scale for the assessment of function in Parkinson's disease. Part III measures 'Motor Function'. It consists of 14 items with 27 questions, each ranging from 0 (normal) to 4 (severe abnormalities). The sum score of the UPDRS Part III ranges from 0 (normal) to 108 (worst score possible).
outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Day 0) to Visit 2 (after at least 4 weeks on a maintenance dose of Neupro®)
outcome.population: Of the 70 patients in the Full Analysis Set (FAS), 67 patients had complete data for UPDRS Part III and are included in the analysis of this outcome measure.

group.title: Neupro® Treatment
group.description: Routine treatment with Neupro® (2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16 mg/24 h) as per approved label in the EU, which is applicable in the EU member states Germany and Austria.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Visit 2 in the Sum Score of the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Part III
measure.description: The UPDRS is a scale for the assessment of function in Parkinson's disease. Part III measures 'Motor Function'. It consists of 14 items with 27 questions, each ranging from 0 (normal) to 4 (severe abnormalities). The sum score of the UPDRS Part III ranges from 0 (normal) to 108 (worst score possible).
measure.population: Of the 70 patients in the Full Analysis Set (FAS), 67 patients had complete data for UPDRS Part III and are included in the analysis of this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Visit 2 in the Sum Score of the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Parts II+III
outcome.description: The UPDRS is a scale for the assessment of function in Parkinson's disease. Part II measures 'Activities of Daily Living' and Part III 'Motor Function'. They consist of 40 questions, each ranging from 0 (normal) to 4 (severe abnormalities). The sum score of the UPDRS Part II+III ranges from 0 (normal) to 160 (worst score possible).
outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Day 0) to Visit 2 (after at least 4 weeks on a maintenance dose of Neupro®)
outcome.population: Of the 70 patients in the Full Analysis Set (FAS), 68 patients had complete data for UPDRS Part II and 67 patients had complete data for UPDRS Part III. Thus, of the 70 patients in the FAS, 67 patients are included in the analysis of this outcome measure.

group.title: Neupro® Treatment
group.description: Routine treatment with Neupro® (2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16 mg/24 h) as per approved label in the EU, which is applicable in the EU member states Germany and Austria.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Visit 2 in the Sum Score of the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Parts II+III
measure.description: The UPDRS is a scale for the assessment of function in Parkinson's disease. Part II measures 'Activities of Daily Living' and Part III 'Motor Function'. They consist of 40 questions, each ranging from 0 (normal) to 4 (severe abnormalities). The sum score of the UPDRS Part II+III ranges from 0 (normal) to 160 (worst score possible).
measure.population: Of the 70 patients in the Full Analysis Set (FAS), 68 patients had complete data for UPDRS Part II and 67 patients had complete data for UPDRS Part III. Thus, of the 70 patients in the FAS, 67 patients are included in the analysis of this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Visit 2 in the Short-form Parkinson's Disease Questionnaire (PDQ-8) Total Score
outcome.description: The PDQ-8 is a self-administered 8 item questionnaire that assesses the overall health status. The questions will be rated from 0 (never) to 4 (always [or cannot do at all]). The total score ranges from 0 (never) to 32 (always [or cannot do at all]) with lower scores indicating a better health status.
outcome.time_frame: From Baseline (Day 0) to Visit 2 (after at least 4 weeks on a maintenance dose of Neupro®)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS). The FAS includes all enrolled patients who had applied the rotigotine transdermal patch at least once and for whom valid data for the primary effectiveness variable were available from Baseline and a subsequent routine visit.

group.title: Neupro® Treatment
group.description: Routine treatment with Neupro® (2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16 mg/24 h) as per approved label in the EU, which is applicable in the EU member states Germany and Austria.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Visit 2 in the Short-form Parkinson's Disease Questionnaire (PDQ-8) Total Score
measure.description: The PDQ-8 is a self-administered 8 item questionnaire that assesses the overall health status. The questions will be rated from 0 (never) to 4 (always [or cannot do at all]). The total score ranges from 0 (never) to 32 (always [or cannot do at all]) with lower scores indicating a better health status.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS). The FAS includes all enrolled patients who had applied the rotigotine transdermal patch at least once and for whom valid data for the primary effectiveness variable were available from Baseline and a subsequent routine visit.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events were collected over the whole study from Visit 1 (Day 0) to Visit 2 (after at least 4 weeks on a maintenance dose of Neupro).
reported_events.desc: Since this was a NIS with no safety objectives, only the related adverse events (AEs), ie, adverse drug reactions (ADRs), were documented.

group.title: Neupro® Treatment
group.description: Routine treatment with Neupro® (2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16 mg/24 h) as per approved label in the EU, which is applicable in the EU member states Germany and Austria.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
